model.develop.my_first_dbt_model.raw_sql:
/*
    Welcome to your first dbt model!
    Did you know that you can also configure models directly within SQL files?
    This will override configurations stated in dbt_project.yml

    Try changing "table" to "view" below
*/

{{ config(materialized='table') }}

with source_data as (

    select 1 as id
    union all
    select null as id

)

select *
from source_data

/*
    Uncomment the line below to remove records with null `id` values
*/

-- where id is not null

model.lever_source.stg_lever__feedback_f.raw_sql:
with base as (

    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__feedback_form_tmp') }}

),

fields as (

    select
        {{
            fivetran_utils.fill_staging_columns(
                source_columns=adapter.get_columns_in_relation(ref('stg_lever__feedback_form_tmp')),
                staging_columns=get_feedback_form_columns()
            )
        }}
        
    from base
),

final as (
    
    select 
        cast(_fivetran_synced as {{ dbt_utils.type_timestamp() }}) as _fivetran_synced,
        cast(completed_at as {{ dbt_utils.type_timestamp() }}) as completed_at,
        cast(created_at as {{ dbt_utils.type_timestamp() }}) as created_at,
        creator_id as creator_user_id,
        cast(deleted_at as {{ dbt_utils.type_timestamp() }}) as deleted_at,
        id as feedback_form_id,
        instructions,
        interview_id,
        opportunity_id,
        score_system_value,
        template_id as template_field_id,
        text as form_title,
        type -- always = interview

    from fields
)

select * from final
model.lever_source.stg_lever__feedback_f.name: stg_lever__feedback_form
model.lever_source.stg_lever__feedback_f.description: Table capturing feedback forms that have been completed after interviewing a candidate.

feedback_form_id.name: feedback_form_id
feedback_form_id.description: Unique id of the feedback form.

completed_at.name: completed_at
completed_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was completed.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was created.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who completed and submitted the feedback.

deleted_at.name: deleted_at
deleted_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was deleted.

interview_id.name: interview_id
interview_id.description: Foreign key referencing the INTERVIEW for which the feedback is directed.

score_system_value.name: score_system_value
score_system_value.description: Overall rating (1-4 scale) to the candidate.

template_field_id.name: template_field_id
template_field_id.description: Foreign key referencing the TEMPLATE_FIELD that this form used.

form_title.name: form_title
form_title.description: Form title. This can be edited in Feedback and Form Settings.

type.name: type
type.description: Form type. Feedback forms are of type interview.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY that the candidate was interviewed for.

model.lever_source.stg_lever__offer.description: Table of the data sent to an opportunity for a position they have been offerred.

creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the offer.

status.description: A string describing the current status of the offer. Can include:  draft - the offer is still under construction approval-sent - the offer needs approval approved - the offer has been approved sent - the offer has been sent through Lever sent-manually - the offer has been sent to the candidate outside of Lever opened - the candidate has opened the offer denied - the candidate denied the offer signed - the candidate signed the offer

model.lever_source.stg_lever__requisitio.raw_sql:
{{ config(enabled=var('lever_using_requisitions', True)) }}

with base as (

    select * 
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__requisition_tmp') }}

),

fields as (

    select
        {{
            fivetran_utils.fill_staging_columns(
                source_columns=adapter.get_columns_in_relation(ref('stg_lever__requisition_tmp')),
                staging_columns=get_requisition_columns()
            )
        }}
        
    from base
),

final as (
    
    select 
        cast(_fivetran_synced as {{ dbt_utils.type_timestamp() }}) as _fivetran_synced,
        backfill as is_backfill,
        compensation_band_currency,
        compensation_band_interval,
        compensation_band_max,
        compensation_band_min,
        cast(created_at as {{ dbt_utils.type_timestamp() }}) as created_at,
        creator_id as creator_user_id,
        employment_status,
        headcount_hired,
        headcount_infinite, 
        headcount_total as headcount_total_allotted,
        hiring_manager_id as hiring_manager_user_id,
        id as requisition_id,
        internal_notes,
        location as job_location,
        name as job_title,
        owner_id as owner_user_id,
        requisition_code,
        status,
        team as job_team

        {% if var('lever_requisition_passthrough_columns', []) != [] %}
        ,
        {{ var('lever_requisition_passthrough_columns', [] )  | join(', ') }}
        {% endif %}
        
    from fields

    where not coalesce(_fivetran_deleted, false)
)

select * from final
model.lever_source.stg_lever__requisitio.name: stg_lever__requisition
model.lever_source.stg_lever__requisitio.description: Table capturing requisitions made in/pushed to lever.

is_backfill.name: is_backfill
is_backfill.description: Boolean that is true if the requisition represents a backfill or new headcount.  If unspecified, defaults to false.

compensation_band_currency.name: compensation_band_currency
compensation_band_currency.description: The ISO currency code associated with the requisition's compensation band.

compensation_band_interval.name: compensation_band_interval
compensation_band_interval.description: The string representing the interval of payment for the compensation band.

compensation_band_max.name: compensation_band_max
compensation_band_max.description: The high bound for the compensation band.

compensation_band_min.name: compensation_band_min
compensation_band_min.description: The low bound for the compensation band.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the requisition was first created.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the requisition.

employment_status.name: employment_status
employment_status.description: The work type of the requisition ('full-time', 'part-time', 'intern', 'contractor', or 'temp-worker').

headcount_hired.name: headcount_hired
headcount_hired.description: The number of filled seats / openings on the requisition, or the string, 'unlimited'.

headcount_total_allotted.name: headcount_total_allotted
headcount_total_allotted.description: Total headcount allotted for this requisition.

hiring_manager_user_id.name: hiring_manager_user_id
hiring_manager_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who is the hiring manager for this requisition.

internal_notes.name: internal_notes
internal_notes.description: Free form text for notes and meta-data about the requisition, visible to anyone who can see the requisition in Lever.

job_location.name: job_location
job_location.description: The location associated with the requisition.

job_title.name: job_title
job_title.description: The human-readable name for the requisition.

owner_user_id.name: owner_user_id
owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who owns the requisition.

status.name: status
status.description: The status of the requisition. Can be 'open', 'onHold', 'closed', or 'draft'.

job_team.name: job_team
job_team.description: The team associated with the requisition

model.lever_source.stg_lever__feedback_f.description: Table capturing the values provided for individual fields within interview feedback forms.

feedback_form_id.name: feedback_form_id
feedback_form_id.description: Foreign key referencing the FEEDBACK_FORM that this field is found in.

field_index.name: field_index
field_index.description: Numerical index of the field's position in the feedback form.

value_index.name: value_index
value_index.description: Index of the value(s) provided for this field. This is relevant if the field is an array.

code_language.name: code_language
code_language.description: Programming language if the interview assessed coding.

currency.name: currency
currency.description: The three-character ISO 4217 Currency Code specifying what currency this field captures.

value_date.name: value_date
value_date.description: If the field is a date-type, this is the value.

value_decimal.name: value_decimal
value_decimal.description: If the field is a decimal, this is the value.

value_file_id.name: value_file_id
value_file_id.description: Foreign key referencing the FILE that was provided as the field value.

value_number.name: value_number
value_number.description: If the field is a numeric, this is the value.

value_text.name: value_text
value_text.description: If the field is a text field, this is the content of the value.

model.lever_source.stg_lever__opportunit.name: stg_lever__opportunity
model.lever_source.stg_lever__opportunit.description: Opportunities represent each candidates' individual journeys/candidacies through your pipeline. An individual candidate might have multiple opportunties if applying to multiple job postings.

archived_at.name: archived_at
archived_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was archived.

archived_reason_id.name: archived_reason_id
archived_reason_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ARCHIVE_REASON for which the opportunity was archived.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: Foreign key referencing the CONTACT info of the candidate applying in this opportunity.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was created (ie when the candidate clicked "apply" on your company website).

is_data_protection_contact_allowed.name: is_data_protection_contact_allowed
is_data_protection_contact_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for contacting  this opportunity's candidate.

data_protection_contact_expires_at.name: data_protection_contact_expires_at
data_protection_contact_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

is_data_protection_store_allowed.name: is_data_protection_store_allowed
is_data_protection_store_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for storing  this opportunity record.

data_protection_store_expires_at.name: data_protection_store_expires_at
data_protection_store_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

contact_headline.name: contact_headline
contact_headline.description: Contact headline, typically a list of previous companies where the contact has worked or  schools that the contact has attended.

is_anonymized.name: is_anonymized
is_anonymized.description: Boolean that is true if the opportunity has been anonymized (therefore fully anonymizing  the contact and removing their *personal* information).

last_advanced_at.name: last_advanced_at
last_advanced_at.description: Timestamp of when the candidate advanced to their current stage in the hiring pipeline.

last_interaction_at.name: last_interaction_at
last_interaction_at.description: Timestamp of when the Opportunity profile was last interacted with. See interactions [here](https://help.lever.co/hc/en-us/articles/205697619).

contact_location.name: contact_location
contact_location.description: Current contact location of the candidate.

origin.name: origin
origin.description: The way in which the opportunity was added to lever. Includes 'agency', 'applied', 'internal', 'referred', 'sourced', and 'university'.

owner_user_id.name: owner_user_id
owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns this opportunity.

snoozed_until.name: snoozed_until
snoozed_until.description: Timestamp of when the current snooze period of this opportunity ends (if snoozed).

stage_id.name: stage_id
stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ID of the current stage of the opportunity.

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was last updated in lever.

model.lever_source.stg_lever__posting.name: stg_lever__posting
model.lever_source.stg_lever__posting.description: Table capturing job postings that candidates can apply to.

posting_id.name: posting_id
posting_id.description: Unique ID of the job posting.

job_commitment.name: job_commitment
job_commitment.description: Tag for job position work type (e.g. Full-time, Part-time, Internship).

job_department.name: job_department
job_department.description: Tag for the department to which the job posting's team belongs, if present.

job_level.name: job_level
job_level.description: Tag for job posting level (e.g. Senior, Junior). Note - this has been deprecated by Lever  but is currently maintained for backward compatibility.

job_team.name: job_team
job_team.description: Tag for the team to which the job posting belongs (a sub-category of department).

content_description.name: content_description
content_description.description: Job posting description that is shown at the top of the job's page, as plaintext.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the posting was created in Lever.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who created the job posting.

owner_user_id.name: owner_user_id
owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns the posting. The posting owner is the  individual who is directly responsible for managing all candidates who are applied to that role.

requisition_code.name: requisition_code
requisition_code.description: Array of requisition codes associated with this posting.

current_state.name: current_state
current_state.description: Current status of the posting, which may include 'published', 'internal' (called 'unlisted' in the UI), 'closed', 'draft', 'pending' (awaiting approval), and 'rejected'.

job_title.name: job_title
job_title.description: Title of the job posting role.

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the posting was last updated.

model.lever_source.stg_lever__applicatio.name: stg_lever__application
model.lever_source.stg_lever__applicatio.description: Table capturing candidate applications to job postings.

archived_at.name: archived_at
archived_at.description: Timestamp of when the application was last archived.

archived_reason_id.name: archived_reason_id
archived_reason_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the ARCHIVE_REASON for which the application was last archived.

comments.name: comments
comments.description: Any additional comments from the candidate included in the job application.

company.name: company
company.description: The candidate's current company or organization.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the application was created.

posting_hiring_manager_user_id.name: posting_hiring_manager_user_id
posting_hiring_manager_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who is the job posting's hiring manager, at the time  the application was submitted.

posting_id.name: posting_id
posting_id.description: Foreign key referencing the job POSTING for which the candidate applied.

posting_owner_user_id.name: posting_owner_user_id
posting_owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns this posting at the time the candidate applied.

referrer_user_id.name: referrer_user_id
referrer_user_id.description: The user ID of the candidate's referrer.

requisition_id.name: requisition_id
requisition_id.description: If the application was archived as hired against a requisition, a foreign key referencing the id of the REQUISITION against which the application was hired.

type.name: type
type.description: Type of the application. An application can be of type referral, user, or posting. Applications of type  referral are created when a user refers a candidate for a job posting. Applications have type user when they  are applied manually to a posting in Lever. Applications have type posting when a candidate applies to a job  posting through your company's jobs page.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the OPPORTUNITY associated with this application.

model.lever_source.stg_lever__interview.name: stg_lever__interview
model.lever_source.stg_lever__interview.description: Table capturing individual interviews (which comprise panels).

canceled_at.name: canceled_at
canceled_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was canceled, if canceled.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was created.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the interview in lever.

occurred_at.name: occurred_at
occurred_at.description: Date + time at which the interview was set to occur.

duration_minutes.name: duration_minutes
duration_minutes.description: Interview duration in minutes, minimum value is 1.

feedback_reminder_frequency.name: feedback_reminder_frequency
feedback_reminder_frequency.description: Frequency of feedback reminders (i.e. once, daily, frequently, none). Defaults to 'frequently' which is every 6 hours.

location.name: location
location.description: Interview location. Usually the name of a booked conference room but can also be a  phone number to call.

panel_id.name: panel_id
panel_id.description: Unique id of the PANEL this interview belongs to.

opportunity_stage_id.name: opportunity_stage_id
opportunity_stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the STAGE that the candidate was in at the time  the interview was scheduled.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: Name of timezone in which interview was scheduled to occur.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY being interviewed for.

source.lever_source.lever.opportunity.name: opportunity
source.lever_source.lever.opportunity.description: Opportunities represent each candidates' individual journeys/candidacies through your pipeline. An individual candidate might have multiple opportunties if applying to multiple job postings.

archived_at.name: archived_at
archived_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was archived.

archived_reason_id.name: archived_reason_id
archived_reason_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ARCHIVE_REASON for which the opportunity was archived.

contact.name: contact
contact.description: Foreign key referencing the CONTACT info of the candidate applying in this opportunity.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was created (ie when the candidate clicked "apply" on your company website).

data_protection_contact_allowed.name: data_protection_contact_allowed
data_protection_contact_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for contacting  this opportunity's candidate.

data_protection_contact_expires_at.name: data_protection_contact_expires_at
data_protection_contact_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

data_protection_store_allowed.name: data_protection_store_allowed
data_protection_store_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for storing  this opportunity record.

data_protection_store_expires_at.name: data_protection_store_expires_at
data_protection_store_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

headline.name: headline
headline.description: Contact headline, typically a list of previous companies where the contact has worked or  schools that the contact has attended.

is_anonymized.name: is_anonymized
is_anonymized.description: Boolean that is true if the opportunity has been anonymized (therefore fully anonymizing  the contact and removing their *personal* information).

last_advanced_at.name: last_advanced_at
last_advanced_at.description: Timestamp of when the candidate advanced to their current stage in the hiring pipeline.

last_interaction_at.name: last_interaction_at
last_interaction_at.description: Timestamp of when the Opportunity profile was last interacted with. See interactions [here](https://help.lever.co/hc/en-us/articles/205697619).

location.name: location
location.description: Current contact location of the candidate.

origin.name: origin
origin.description: The way in which the opportunity was added to lever. Includes 'agency', 'applied', 'internal', 'referred', 'sourced', and 'university'.

owner_id.name: owner_id
owner_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns this opportunity.

snoozed_until.name: snoozed_until
snoozed_until.description: Timestamp of when the current snooze period of this opportunity ends (if snoozed).

stage_id.name: stage_id
stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ID of the current stage of the opportunity.

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was last updated in lever.

source.lever_source.lever.posting.name: posting
source.lever_source.lever.posting.description: Table capturing job postings that candidates can apply to.

id.name: id
id.description: Unique ID of the job posting.

_fivetran_deleted.name: _fivetran_deleted
_fivetran_deleted.description: Boolean that is true if the posting has been soft-deleted.

categories_commitment.name: categories_commitment
categories_commitment.description: Tag for job position work type (e.g. Full-time, Part-time, Internship).

categories_department.name: categories_department
categories_department.description: Tag for the department to which the job posting's team belongs, if present.

categories_level.name: categories_level
categories_level.description: Tag for job posting level (e.g. Senior, Junior). Note - this has been deprecated by Lever  but is currently maintained for backward compatibility.

categories_team.name: categories_team
categories_team.description: Tag for the team to which the job posting belongs (a sub-category of department).

content_closing.name: content_closing
content_closing.description: Closing statement on the job posting, in plaintext.

content_closing_html.name: content_closing_html
content_closing_html.description: Closing statement on job posting, as styled HTML.

content_description.name: content_description
content_description.description: Job posting description that is shown at the top of the job's page, as plaintext.

content_description_html.name: content_description_html
content_description_html.description: Job posting description that is shown at the top of the job's page, in HTML.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the posting was created in Lever.

creator_id.name: creator_id
creator_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who created the job posting.

owner_id.name: owner_id
owner_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns the posting. The posting owner is the  individual who is directly responsible for managing all candidates who are applied to that role.

requisition_code.name: requisition_code
requisition_code.description: Array of requisition codes associated with this posting.

state.name: state
state.description: Current status of the posting, which may include 'published', 'internal' (called 'unlisted' in the UI), 'closed', 'draft', 'pending' (awaiting approval), and 'rejected'.

text.name: text
text.description: Title of the job posting role.

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the posting was last updated.

source.lever_source.lever.posting_tag.name: posting_tag
source.lever_source.lever.posting_tag.description: Table associating job postings with all associated tags.

posting_id.name: posting_id
posting_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the job POSTING.

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Text of the posting's individual tag.

_fivetran_deleted.name: _fivetran_deleted
_fivetran_deleted.description: Boolean that is true if the posting-tag association has been deleted.

source.lever_source.lever.posting_interv.name: posting_interview
source.lever_source.lever.posting_interv.description: Table relating job postings to any interviews undertaken for the role.

interview_id.name: interview_id
interview_id.description: Foreign key referencing the INTERVIEW for this job posting.

posting_id.name: posting_id
posting_id.description: Foreign key referencing the POSTING that was interviewed for.

source.lever_source.lever.user.name: user
source.lever_source.lever.user.description: Table of Lever users (anyone who has been invited to join the recruiting efforts).

_fivetran_deleted.name: _fivetran_deleted
_fivetran_deleted.description: Boolean that is true if the user has been soft-deleted.

access_role.name: access_role
access_role.description: The user's access role, which can be 'super admin', 'admin', 'team member', 'limited team member', or 'interviewer'. Information on what the roles entail can be found  [here](https://help.lever.co/hc/en-us/articles/360042645691-What-are-the-differences-between-access-roles-in-Lever-#:~:text=There%20are%205%20different%20access,information%2C%20and%20permission%20granting%20privileges).

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the user was created.

deactivated_at.name: deactivated_at
deactivated_at.description: Timestamp of when the user was deactivated (null for active users).

external_directory_id.name: external_directory_id
external_directory_id.description: Unique ID of the user in an external HR directory, if provided.

photo.name: photo
photo.description: URL for user's gravatar, if enabled.

username.name: username
username.description: Username, extracted from user's email address.

source.lever_source.lever.interviewer_us.name: interviewer_user
source.lever_source.lever.interviewer_us.description: Table relating interviews to their interviewers.

interview_id.name: interview_id
interview_id.description: Foreign key referencing the INTERVIEW that was given.

user_id.name: user_id
user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER that interviewed the candidate.

source.lever_source.lever.opportunity_st.name: opportunity_stage_history
source.lever_source.lever.opportunity_st.description: Table capturing the different stages that each opportunity has passed through in the pipeline.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the OPPORTUNITY.

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was changed to this stage.

stage_id.name: stage_id
stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the STAGE that the opportunity was changed to.

updater_id.name: updater_id
updater_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who changed the opportunity stage.

to_stage_index.name: to_stage_index
to_stage_index.description: The index of the stage in the pipeline at the time the stage change occurred.

source.lever_source.lever.stage.name: stage
source.lever_source.lever.stage.description: Table of steps in the recruiting workflow of your hiring pipeline.

source.lever_source.lever.opportunity_so.name: opportunity_source
source.lever_source.lever.opportunity_so.description: Table relating opportunities to all of their individual sources.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY that was sourced.

source.name: source
source.description: Where this opportunity was sourced from (ie 'linkedin').

source.lever_source.lever.opportunity_ta.name: opportunity_tag
source.lever_source.lever.opportunity_ta.description: Table relating opportunities to their tags.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY that was tagged.

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Text of the tag associated with this opportunity.

source.lever_source.lever.application.name: application
source.lever_source.lever.application.description: Table capturing candidate applications to job postings.

archived_at.name: archived_at
archived_at.description: Timestamp of when the application was last archived.

archived_reason_id.name: archived_reason_id
archived_reason_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the ARCHIVE_REASON for which the application was last archived.

comments.name: comments
comments.description: Any additional comments from the candidate included in the job application.

company.name: company
company.description: The candidate's current company or organization.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the application was created.

posting_hiring_manager_id.name: posting_hiring_manager_id
posting_hiring_manager_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who is the job posting's hiring manager, at the time  the application was submitted.

posting_id.name: posting_id
posting_id.description: Foreign key referencing the job POSTING for which the candidate applied.

posting_owner_id.name: posting_owner_id
posting_owner_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns this posting at the time the candidate applied.

referrer_id.name: referrer_id
referrer_id.description: The user ID of the candidate's referrer.

requisition_for_hire_id.name: requisition_for_hire_id
requisition_for_hire_id.description: If the application was archived as hired against a requisition, a foreign key referencing the id of the REQUISITION against which the application was hired.

type.name: type
type.description: Type of the application. An application can be of type referral, user, or posting. Applications of type  referral are created when a user refers a candidate for a job posting. Applications have type user when they  are applied manually to a posting in Lever. Applications have type posting when a candidate applies to a job  posting through your company's jobs page.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the OPPORTUNITY associated with this application.

source.lever_source.lever.offer.name: offer
source.lever_source.lever.offer.description: Table of the data sent to an opportunity for a position they have been offerred.

candidate_id.name: candidate_id
candidate_id.description: Unique ID of the candidate or opportunity??

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the offer was created.

creator_id.name: creator_id
creator_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the offer.

status.name: status
status.description: A string describing the current status of the offer. Can include:  draft - the offer is still under construction approval-sent - the offer needs approval approved - the offer has been approved sent - the offer has been sent through Lever sent-manually - the offer has been sent to the candidate outside of Lever opened - the candidate has opened the offer denied - the candidate denied the offer signed - the candidate signed the offer

source.lever_source.lever.archive_reason.name: archive_reason
source.lever_source.lever.archive_reason.description: Table of reasons for archiving candidates, exiting them from the hiring pipeline (after hiring or rejecting  for a particular reason).

id.name: id
id.description: Unique id of the archive reason.

text.name: text
text.description: Name of the archive reason as shown in the Lever UI.

_fivetran_deleted.name: _fivetran_deleted
_fivetran_deleted.description: Boolean that is true if the archive reason has been soft-deleted.

source.lever_source.lever.interview.name: interview
source.lever_source.lever.interview.description: Table capturing individual interviews (which comprise panels).

canceled_at.name: canceled_at
canceled_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was canceled, if canceled.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was created.

creator_id.name: creator_id
creator_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the interview in lever.

date.name: date
date.description: Date + time at which the interview was set to occur.

duration.name: duration
duration.description: Interview duration in minutes, minimum value is 1.

feedback_reminder.name: feedback_reminder
feedback_reminder.description: Frequency of feedback reminders (i.e. once, daily, frequently, none). Defaults to 'frequently' which is every 6 hours.

location.name: location
location.description: Interview location. Usually the name of a booked conference room but can also be a  phone number to call.

panel_id.name: panel_id
panel_id.description: Unique id of the PANEL this interview belongs to.

stage_id.name: stage_id
stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the STAGE that the candidate was in at the time  the interview was scheduled.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: Name of timezone in which interview was scheduled to occur.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY being interviewed for.

source.lever_source.lever.interview_feed.name: interview_feedback
source.lever_source.lever.interview_feed.description: Table associating interviews with their feedback forms.

feedback_form_id.name: feedback_form_id
feedback_form_id.description: Foreign key referencing the FEEDBACK_FORM submitted for this interview.

interview_id.name: interview_id
interview_id.description: Foreign key referencing the INTERVIEW that was given feedback for.

source.lever_source.lever.feedback_form.name: feedback_form
source.lever_source.lever.feedback_form.description: Table capturing feedback forms that have been completed after interviewing a candidate.

id.name: id
id.description: Unique id of the feedback form.

completed_at.name: completed_at
completed_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was completed.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was created.

creator_id.name: creator_id
creator_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who completed and submitted the feedback.

deleted_at.name: deleted_at
deleted_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was deleted.

interview_id.name: interview_id
interview_id.description: Foreign key referencing the INTERVIEW for which the feedback is directed.

score_system_value.name: score_system_value
score_system_value.description: Overall rating (1-4 scale) to the candidate.

template_id.name: template_id
template_id.description: Foreign key referencing the TEMPLATE_FIELD that this form used.

text.name: text
text.description: Form title. This can be edited in Feedback and Form Settings.

type.name: type
type.description: Form type. Feedback forms are of type interview.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY that the candidate was interviewed for.

source.lever_source.lever.feedback_form_.name: feedback_form_field
source.lever_source.lever.feedback_form_.description: Table capturing the values provided for individual fields within interview feedback forms.

feedback_form_id.name: feedback_form_id
feedback_form_id.description: Foreign key referencing the FEEDBACK_FORM that this field is found in.

field_index.name: field_index
field_index.description: Numerical index of the field's position in the feedback form.

value_index.name: value_index
value_index.description: Index of the value(s) provided for this field. This is relevant if the field is an array. todo

code_language.name: code_language
code_language.description: Programming language if the interview assessed coding.

currency.name: currency
currency.description: The three-character ISO 4217 Currency Code specifying what currency this field captures.

value_date.name: value_date
value_date.description: If the field is a date-type, this is the value.

value_decimal.name: value_decimal
value_decimal.description: If the field is a decimal, this is the value.

value_file_id.name: value_file_id
value_file_id.description: Foreign key referencing the FILE that was provided as the field value.

value_number.name: value_number
value_number.description: If the field is a numeric, this is the value.

value_text.name: value_text
value_text.description: If the field is a text field, this is the content of the value.

source.lever_source.lever.requisition.name: requisition
source.lever_source.lever.requisition.description: Table capturing requisitions made in/pushed to lever.

_fivetran_deleted.name: _fivetran_deleted
_fivetran_deleted.description: Boolean that is true if the requisition has been soft-deleted.

backfill.name: backfill
backfill.description: Boolean that is true if the requisition represents a backfill or new headcount.  If unspecified, defaults to false.

compensation_band_currency.name: compensation_band_currency
compensation_band_currency.description: The ISO currency code associated with the requisition's compensation band.

compensation_band_interval.name: compensation_band_interval
compensation_band_interval.description: The string representing the interval of payment for the compensation band.

compensation_band_max.name: compensation_band_max
compensation_band_max.description: The high bound for the compensation band.

compensation_band_min.name: compensation_band_min
compensation_band_min.description: The low bound for the compensation band.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the requisition was first created.

creator_id.name: creator_id
creator_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the requisition.

employment_status.name: employment_status
employment_status.description: The work type of the requisition ('full-time', 'part-time', 'intern', 'contractor', or 'temp-worker').

headcount_hired.name: headcount_hired

macro.dbt_bigquery.bigquery__get_catalog.name: bigquery__get_catalog
macro.dbt_bigquery.bigquery__get_catalog.macro_sql:
{% macro bigquery__get_catalog(information_schema, schemas) -%}

  {%- if (schemas | length) == 0 -%}
    {# Hopefully nothing cares about the columns we return when there are no rows #}
    {%- set query  = "select 1 as id limit 0" -%}
  {%- else -%}

  {%- set query -%}
    with tables as (
        select
            project_id as table_database,
            dataset_id as table_schema,
            table_id as original_table_name,

            concat(project_id, '.', dataset_id, '.', table_id) as relation_id,

            row_count,
            size_bytes as size_bytes,
            case
                when type = 1 then 'table'
                when type = 2 then 'view'
                else 'external'
            end as table_type,

            REGEXP_CONTAINS(table_id, '^.+[0-9]{8}$') and coalesce(type, 0) = 1 as is_date_shard,
            REGEXP_EXTRACT(table_id, '^(.+)[0-9]{8}$') as shard_base_name,
            REGEXP_EXTRACT(table_id, '^.+([0-9]{8})$') as shard_name

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='__TABLES__') }}
        where (
          {%- for schema in schemas -%}
            upper(dataset_id) = upper('{{ schema }}'){%- if not loop.last %} or {% endif -%}
          {%- endfor -%}
        )
    ),

    extracted as (

        select *,
            case
                when is_date_shard then shard_base_name
                else original_table_name
            end as table_name

        from tables

    ),

    unsharded_tables as (

        select
            table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,
            coalesce(table_type, 'external') as table_type,
            is_date_shard,

            struct(
                min(shard_name) as shard_min,
                max(shard_name) as shard_max,
                count(*) as shard_count
            ) as table_shards,

            sum(size_bytes) as size_bytes,
            sum(row_count) as row_count,

            max(relation_id) as relation_id

        from extracted
        group by 1,2,3,4,5

    ),

    info_schema_columns as (

        select
            concat(table_catalog, '.', table_schema, '.', table_name) as relation_id,
            table_catalog as table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,

            -- use the "real" column name from the paths query below
            column_name as base_column_name,
            ordinal_position as column_index,

            is_partitioning_column,
            clustering_ordinal_position

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='COLUMNS') }}
        where ordinal_position is not null

    ),

    info_schema_column_paths as (

        select
            concat(table_catalog, '.', table_schema, '.', table_name) as relation_id,
            field_path as column_name,
            data_type as column_type,
            column_name as base_column_name,
            description as column_comment

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='COLUMN_FIELD_PATHS') }}

    ),

    columns as (

        select * except (base_column_name)
        from info_schema_columns
        join info_schema_column_paths using (relation_id, base_column_name)

    ),

    column_stats as (

        select
            table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,
            max(relation_id) as relation_id,
            max(case when is_partitioning_column = 'YES' then 1 else 0 end) = 1 as is_partitioned,
            max(case when is_partitioning_column = 'YES' then column_name else null end) as partition_column,
            max(case when clustering_ordinal_position is not null then 1 else 0 end) = 1 as is_clustered,
            array_to_string(
                array_agg(
                    case
                        when clustering_ordinal_position is not null then column_name
                        else null
                    end ignore nulls
                    order by clustering_ordinal_position
                ), ', '
            ) as clustering_columns

        from columns
        group by 1,2,3

    )

    select
        unsharded_tables.table_database,
        unsharded_tables.table_schema,
        case
            when is_date_shard then concat(unsharded_tables.table_name, '*')
            else unsharded_tables.table_name
        end as table_name,
        unsharded_tables.table_type,

        -- coalesce name and type for External tables - these columns are not
        -- present in the COLUMN_FIELD_PATHS resultset
        coalesce(columns.column_name, '<unknown>') as column_name,
        -- invent a row number to account for nested fields -- BQ does
        -- not treat these nested properties as independent fields
        row_number() over (
            partition by relation_id
            order by columns.column_index, columns.column_name
        ) as column_index,
        coalesce(columns.column_type, '<unknown>') as column_type,
        columns.column_comment,

        'Shard count' as `stats__date_shards__label`,
        table_shards.shard_count as `stats__date_shards__value`,
        'The number of date shards in this table' as `stats__date_shards__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shards__include`,

        'Shard (min)' as `stats__date_shard_min__label`,
        table_shards.shard_min as `stats__date_shard_min__value`,
        'The first date shard in this table' as `stats__date_shard_min__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shard_min__include`,

        'Shard (max)' as `stats__date_shard_max__label`,
        table_shards.shard_max as `stats__date_shard_max__value`,
        'The last date shard in this table' as `stats__date_shard_max__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shard_max__include`,

        '# Rows' as `stats__num_rows__label`,
        row_count as `stats__num_rows__value`,
        'Approximate count of rows in this table' as `stats__num_rows__description`,
        (unsharded_tables.table_type = 'table') as `stats__num_rows__include`,

        'Approximate Size' as `stats__num_bytes__label`,
        size_bytes as `stats__num_bytes__value`,
        'Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery' as `stats__num_bytes__description`,
        (unsharded_tables.table_type = 'table') as `stats__num_bytes__include`,

        'Partitioned By' as `stats__partitioning_type__label`,
        partition_column as `stats__partitioning_type__value`,
        'The partitioning column for this table' as `stats__partitioning_type__description`,
        is_partitioned as `stats__partitioning_type__include`,

        'Clustered By' as `stats__clustering_fields__label`,
        clustering_columns as `stats__clustering_fields__value`,
        'The clustering columns for this table' as `stats__clustering_fields__description`,
        is_clustered as `stats__clustering_fields__include`

    -- join using relation_id (an actual relation, not a shard prefix) to make
    -- sure that column metadata is picked up through the join. This will only
    -- return the column information for the "max" table in a date-sharded table set
    from unsharded_tables
    left join columns using (relation_id)
    left join column_stats using (relation_id)
  {%- endset -%}

  {%- endif -%}

  {{ return(run_query(query)) }}

{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt.snapshot_merge_sql.name: snapshot_merge_sql

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.name: default__snapshot_merge_sql
macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.macro_sql:
{% macro default__snapshot_merge_sql(target, source, insert_cols) -%}
    {%- set insert_cols_csv = insert_cols | join(', ') -%}

    merge into {{ target }} as DBT_INTERNAL_DEST
    using {{ source }} as DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE
    on DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_scd_id = DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_scd_id

    when matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_valid_to is null
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type in ('update', 'delete')
        then update
        set dbt_valid_to = DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_valid_to

    when not matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type = 'insert'
        then insert ({{ insert_cols_csv }})
        values ({{ insert_cols_csv }})

{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_staging_tabl.name: default__snapshot_staging_table
macro.dbt.default__snapshot_staging_tabl.macro_sql:
{% macro default__snapshot_staging_table(strategy, source_sql, target_relation) -%}

    with snapshot_query as (

        {{ source_sql }}

    ),

    snapshotted_data as (

        select *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key

        from {{ target_relation }}
        where dbt_valid_to is null

    ),

    insertions_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            nullif({{ strategy.updated_at }}, {{ strategy.updated_at }}) as dbt_valid_to,
            {{ strategy.scd_id }} as dbt_scd_id

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    updates_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_to

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes %}

    deletes_source_data as (

        select 
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key
        from snapshot_query
    ),
    {% endif %}

    insertions as (

        select
            'insert' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*

        from insertions_source_data as source_data
        left outer join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is null
           or (
                snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is not null
            and (
                {{ strategy.row_changed }}
            )
        )

    ),

    updates as (

        select
            'update' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id

        from updates_source_data as source_data
        join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where (
            {{ strategy.row_changed }}
        )
    )

    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes -%}
    ,

    deletes as (
    
        select
            'delete' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_valid_to,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id
    
        from snapshotted_data
        left join deletes_source_data as source_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where source_data.dbt_unique_key is null
    )
    {%- endif %}

    select * from insertions
    union all
    select * from updates
    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes %}
    union all
    select * from deletes
    {%- endif %}

{%- endmacro %}

macro.fivetran_utils.bigquery__get_colum.macro_sql:
{% macro bigquery__get_columns_for_macro(table_name, schema_name, database_name=target.database) %}

{% set query %}

select
    concat(
      '{"name": "', 
      lower(column_name), 
      '", "datatype": ',
      case
        when lower(data_type) like '%timestamp%' then 'dbt_utils.type_timestamp()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'string' then 'dbt_utils.type_string()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'bool' then '"boolean"'
        when lower(data_type) like '%num%' then 'dbt_utils.type_numeric()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'float64' then 'dbt_utils.type_float()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'int64' then 'dbt_utils.type_int()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'date' then '"date"' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'datetime' then '"datetime"' 
      end,
      '}')
from `{{ database_name }}`.{{ schema_name }}.INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS
where lower(table_name) = '{{ table_name }}'
and lower(table_schema) = '{{ schema_name }}'
order by 1

{% endset %}

{% set results = run_query(query) %}
{% set results_list = results.columns[0].values() %}}

{{ return(results_list) }}

{% endmacro %}

dbt.__overview__.name: __overview__
dbt.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the auto-generated documentation for your dbt project!

### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models
in your project.

#### Project Tab
The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the
models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab
The `Database` tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view
shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are _not_ shown
in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration
You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand`
button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build,
or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--select` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the
models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.

---

- Read the [dbt viewpoint](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/viewpoint)
